seasons.episode_plot: A series of romantic Valentine's Day parodies based on "Bonnie and Clyde," "Lady and the Tramp," and "Sid and Nancy."

seasons.title: The DeBarted
seasons.episode_plot: The new prankster in Bart's fourth grade class actually turns out to be a mole brought in by Principal Skinner to infiltrate Bart's inner circle. Homer falls in love with his loaner car after Marge wrecks their old one.

seasons.title: Dial 'N' for Nerder
seasons.episode_plot: One of Bart's pranks results in Martin's death, but Lisa doesn't want him to confess because she would be considered an accomplice. Marge hires a television crew to find out if Homer is cheating on his diet.

seasons.title: Smoke on the Daughter
seasons.episode_plot: Marge has Lisa take up ballet, mainly to have Lisa live out her own childhood dreams. Lisa then succumbs to peer pressure from her ballet mates and takes up smoking. Meanwhile, Homer and Bart try to start their own beef jerky business.

seasons.title: Papa Don't Leech
seasons.episode_plot: When the Simpsons discover that Lurleen Lumpkin is on the skids, Marge reluctantly agrees to take her in and help her find her deadbeat dad who abandoned her 30 years ago.

seasons.title: Apocalypse Cow
seasons.episode_plot: Bart tries to save the cow he raised for his 4-H club from the slaughterhouse, and in the process winds up getting accidentally engaged to one of Cletus's daughters.

seasons.title: Any Given Sundance
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa's documentary about her family is accepted into the Sundance Film Festival. However, her family gets upset with her when they discover that the film is far from flattering.

seasons.title: Mona Leaves-a
seasons.episode_plot: Homer's mom dies, and as part of her will, she asks him to spread her ashes. However, her request turns out to be part of her final act of rebellion against the system.

seasons.title: All About Lisa
seasons.episode_plot: In a parody of "All About Eve," Lisa stabs Krusty in the back, takes his job, and wins a prestigious award. Meanwhile, Homer and Bart take up coin collecting.

seasons.title: Sex, Pies and Idiot Scrapes
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Ned go into business together as bounty hunters, and Marge takes a job at an erotic bakery.

seasons.title: Lost Verizon
seasons.episode_plot: Bart gets in trouble with Marge after she finds out that he has Denis Leary's cell phone and is using it to make prank phone calls.

seasons.title: Double, Double, Boy in Trouble
seasons.episode_plot: Bart trades lives with his multi-millionaire lookalike, but discovers that his lookalike's life isn't all he thought it would be.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XIX
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons' 19th Halloween Special, with parodies of "Transformers," "Mad Men," and "It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown."

seasons.title: Dangerous Curves
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons take a Fourth of July vacation to a cabin hotel, which cause Homer and Marge to reminisce about two episodes from their past where they stayed in the cabin.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
seasons.title: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
seasons.episode_plot: Homer gets a job breaking up couples, and Lisa becomes an expert crossword puzzle solver, but Homer bets against her in a competition.

seasons.title: MyPods and Boomsticks
seasons.episode_plot: Homer suspects that the family of Bart's new Muslim friend from Jordan is part of a terrorist plot, and Lisa becomes obsessed with her new MyPod.

seasons.title: The Burns and the Bees
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game, and the new arena he plans to have Springfield build for the team threatens to interfere with Lisa's new bee sanctuary.

seasons.title: Lisa the Drama Queen
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa and her new best friend create their own fantasy world, but Marge doesn't want Lisa to see her friend anymore after she finds out that they're too far gone in it.

seasons.title: Take My Life, Please
seasons.episode_plot: Homer finds out that he actually won the senior class president election, and he gets an opportunity to find out how his life would have been different if it had happened.

seasons.title: How the Test Was Won
seasons.episode_plot: Bart and his fellow underachievers are taken on a "field trip" to Capital City so that they can miss the standardized test, and Homer makes sure that nothing bad happens until their insurance goes back into effect.

seasons.title: No Loan Again, Naturally
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons lose their house, but Flanders buys it and offers to rent it back to them. But when they turn out to be less-than-reliable renters, Flanders kicks them out.

seasons.title: Gone Maggie Gone
seasons.episode_plot: In order to rescue Maggie from a Catholic orphanage, Lisa must solve a series of puzzles to reveal the identity of a gem that will bring peace to Springfield.

seasons.epi_image_alt: In the Name of the Grandfather
seasons.title: In the Name of the Grandfather
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons take Grandpa to Ireland so he can go back to visit a pub he went to during the war, but Grandpa and Homer get suckered into buying the bar.

seasons.title: Wedding for Disaster
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is kidnapped moments before he and Marge are supposed to re-renew their vows. However, Marge comes to the conclusion that Homer left her at the altar.

seasons.title: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe
seasons.episode_plot: Moe begins dating a little person he met on the Internet, while Maggie is being bullied at the playground next to Moe's where Homer is leaving her.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
seasons.title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
seasons.episode_plot: Bart gets Milhouse to take the rap for a prank at school, and then blows him off when he falls for a cute 5th grade do-gooder, prompting Milhouse's wrath. Meanwhile, Lisa begins taking "happy pills" to improve her negative outlook.

seasons.title: Father Knows Worst
seasons.episode_plot: Homer becomes a "helicopter parent" at Springfield Elementary by helping Bart finish a class project and helping Lisa become popular, and Marge finds a secret sauna in their house.

seasons.title: Waverly Hills, 9021-D'Oh
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons set up a fake residence in Waverly Hills so that Bart and Lisa can attend school there.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Four Great Women and a Manicure
seasons.title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
seasons.episode_plot: A series of parodies based on four strong women: Queen Elizabeth, Snow White, Lady MacBeth, and Ayn Rand.

seasons.title: Coming to Homerica
seasons.episode_plot: Townspeople build a wall around Springfield to keep "immigrants" from Ogdenville from relocating to their town.

seasons.title: Homer the Whopper
seasons.episode_plot: A Hollywood studio makes a movie based on Comic Book Guy's comic book character "Everyman," and Homer is cast in the lead. However, Homer's weight fluctuations cause problems for the production.

seasons.title: Bart Gets a 'Z'
seasons.episode_plot: When Bart's prank gets Ms. Krabappel fired from Springfield Elementary School, he tries to make it up to her without letting her know that he was responsible.

seasons.title: The Great Wife Hope
seasons.episode_plot: Marge takes on the owner of an ultimate fighting league in the ring in order to get the sport banned in Springfield.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XX
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa becomes livid with Miss Hoover, and in a series of homages to classic Hitchcock sets out for deadly revenge. Next, Krusty's latest fast-food sandwich transforms news anchor Kent Brockman into an enraged zombie and twenty-eight days later, cannibal zombies have overrun Springfield. In the final frightening fable, Homer accidentally falls through a trapdoor in Moe's tavern and impales himself on the pipes of Moe's microbrewery. Moe serves the barflies a glass of delicious beer flavored with Homer's blood and Homer, now half-man, half-brewing apparatus, returns for ...

seasons.title: The Devil Wears Nada
seasons.episode_plot: Marge rediscovers her sexuality after appearing in a racy calendar, but Homer is too tired to respond to her advances because he is being worked to death by his new boss, Carl.

seasons.title: Pranks and Greens
seasons.episode_plot: Bart meets the boy responsible for the greatest prank in Springfield Elementary School history, and discovers that he's now a 19-year-old loser. Meanwhile, Marge is scolded for providing unhealthy snacks for Maggie's play group.

seasons.title: Rednecks and Broomsticks
seasons.episode_plot: Homer becomes an expert on moonshine when he starts hanging out with Cletus after he saves the Simpsons' lives, while Lisa becomes friends with three teenage Wiccans.

seasons.title: Oh Brother, Where Bart Thou?
seasons.episode_plot: Bart becomes jealous of Maggie and Lisa's special bond as sisters, so he goes to an orphanage and "adopts" a little brother.

seasons.title: Thursdays with Abie
seasons.episode_plot: Homer becomes jealous when a syndicated newspaper columnist begins publishing Grandpa's stories, while Bart is assigned to take care of the class's stuffed sheep for the weekend.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
seasons.title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
seasons.episode_plot: The antagonism between Krusty and the new female co-star forced upon him soon turns to romance, while a headhunter encourages Homer, Lenny and Carl to take a job at another nuclear power plant.

seasons.title: Million Dollar Maybe
seasons.episode_plot: Homer can't tell Marge he won the lottery because he was supposed to be giving a wedding toast when he bought the ticket. But Bart soon finds out where he's hiding the money and begins to blackmail him.

seasons.title: Boy Meets Curl
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Marge become members of the U.S. Olympic curling team. At the games, Lisa becomes addicted to collecting pins, and Bart tries to save her.

seasons.title: The Color Yellow
seasons.episode_plot: While searching for an admirable ancestor for a class project, Lisa discovers the story of a relative named Eliza Simpson, who may or may not have helped a slave escape to freedom.

seasons.title: Postcards from the Wedge
seasons.episode_plot: When Bart unsuccessfully tries to play Homer and Marge against each other, he comes up with a dangerous prank that is sure to get their attention.

seasons.title: Stealing First Base
seasons.episode_plot: Bart gets Springfield Elementary School in legal trouble when he kisses the enigmatic daughter of two lawyers, while Lisa is depressed about being ostracized because she is smart.

seasons.title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed
seasons.episode_plot: Ned takes the Simpsons on a pilgrimage to Israel in order to try and save Homer, but soon discovers that he may not be worth saving.

seasons.title: American History X-cellent
seasons.episode_plot: Mr Burns is sent to prison for art theft, where a scary inmate introduces him to religion. Meanwhile Smithers becomes the boss at the plant, and Bart and Lisa try to share an ant farm.

seasons.title: Chief of Hearts
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Chief Wiggum's new friendship is put to the test when the chief becomes needy after being shot, while Marge suspects that Bart may be dealing drugs.

seasons.title: The Squirt and the Whale
seasons.episode_plot: After a violent storm, Lisa tries to rally the townspeople and come to the rescue of a beached whale.

seasons.title: To Surveil, with Love
seasons.episode_plot: Springfield covers the town with surveillance cameras after Homer creates a bomb scare at the train station. Meanwhile, Lisa considers becoming a brunette so that people will take her more seriously.

seasons.title: Moe Letter Blues
seasons.episode_plot: Homer, Apu and Reverend Lovejoy all suspect that Moe may have left with one of their wives after receiving a mysterious letter, but which one is it?

seasons.title: The Bob Next Door
seasons.episode_plot: Bart is convinced that the Simpsons' new friendly, unassuming neighbor is actually Sideshow Bob in disguise.

seasons.title: Judge Me Tender
seasons.episode_plot: Moe's gruff and abrasive personality makes him the perfect hyper-critical judge, and lands him a spot on American Idol. Meanwhile, Homer makes Marge uncomfortable when he starts spending more time at home with Moe's now closed.

seasons.title: Elementary School Musical
seasons.episode_plot: While Homer and Bart accompany Krusty to Oslo so he can receive the Nobel Peace Prize, Marge enrolls Lisa for a week in performing arts camp.

seasons.title: Loan-a Lisa
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa uses the $50 she receives from Grandpa to give Nelson a microloan to jump-start his bicycle business, but soon comes to regret the decision.

seasons.title: MoneyBart
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa takes over as manager of Bart's baseball team and uses statistical analysis to build a winner, but she takes all of the fun out of it and causes Bart to quit the team.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXI
seasons.episode_plot: A Satanic board game causes other popular board games to come to life, Homer and Marge rescue a possible killer and let him on their boat, and a parody of "Twilight" where Lisa falls for a young vampire.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
seasons.title: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
seasons.episode_plot: When Lisa discovers that Marge was also a model student, she tries to find out where everything changed so that she doesn't repeat her mistakes. Meanwhile, a series of chance accidents cause Bart to replace Nelson as school bully.

seasons.title: The Fool Monty
seasons.episode_plot: After Mr. Burns finds out that he is dying, he has an accident and loses his memory, and all the townspeople use the situation to get their revenge on him.

seasons.epi_image_alt: How Munched Is That Birdie in the Window?
seasons.title: How Munched Is That Birdie in the Window?
seasons.episode_plot: Bart adopts a carrier pigeon, but Santa's Little Helper eats it.

seasons.title: The Fight Before Christmas
seasons.episode_plot: Marge gets depressed when the rest of the family does not get into the holiday spirit, and she writes a letter, hoping to get some help; Mr. Burns and Moe's new friend delay the Simpsons as they attempt to travel to Hawaii for the holiday.

seasons.title: Donnie Fatso
seasons.episode_plot: Homer goes to prison after attempting to get out of a series of fines with a bribe, but agrees to a reduced sentence by informing on Fat Tony for the FBI.

seasons.title: Moms I'd Like to Forget
seasons.episode_plot: Bart sets out to uncover the origins of a sword-shaped scar on his hand; Marge reconnects with three friends she fell out with years ago.

seasons.title: Flaming Moe
seasons.episode_plot: Moe tries to keep his 'straightness' a secret when he opens a gay bar; Skinner falls for a new teacher.

seasons.title: Homer the Father
seasons.episode_plot: Homer picks up parenting advice from an 80s sitcom; Bart becomes involved in trading nuclear secrets.

seasons.title: The Blue and the Gray
seasons.episode_plot: Moe employs Homer as his wing man, only to find Homer has more luck with the ladies than he does; Marge finds her first gray hair.

seasons.title: Angry Dad: The Movie
seasons.episode_plot: Bart's "Angry Dad" character gets his own movie, but when the movie starts winning awards, Homer tries to hog all the credit.

seasons.title: The Scorpion's Tale
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa's school project leads to the discovery of a new drug that makes the elderly less cranky and more tolerable.

seasons.title: A Midsummer's Nice Dreams
seasons.episode_plot: After Tommy Chong walks away from the Cheech & Chong reunion tour, Homer goes on the road as his replacement. Meanwhile, Marge tries to help the cat lady with her hoarding problem.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Love Is a Many Strangled Thing
seasons.title: Love Is a Many Strangled Thing
seasons.episode_plot: The tables are turned for Homer and Bart after a therapist cures Homer of his violent tendencies toward the boy.

seasons.title: The Great Simpsina
seasons.episode_plot: The family is greeted by folk singer Ewell Freestone when they visit a peach farm, but when Marge goes overboard with peach-inspired dishes, Lisa and Bart try to get rid of the unwanted fruit. Later, Lisa becomes a magician's apprentice to the legendary Great Raymondo who helps her develop her craft, but a schoolgirl crush clouds her judgment when she is coaxed into revealing the Great Raymondo's most famous magic trick to his phony archnemesis. But when the rival magician's act takes a risky turn, the Great Raymondo has one last trick up his sleeve and stages ...

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Real Housewives of Fat Tony
seasons.title: The Real Housewives of Fat Tony
seasons.episode_plot: Selma falls in love with and marries Fat Tony, and Lisa discovers that Bart has a skill for finding truffles.

seasons.title: Homer Scissorhands
seasons.episode_plot: Homer opens his own salon after he discovers that he has skills as a hair stylist, and Lisa becomes suspicious after Millhouse gets a 5th grade girlfriend.

seasons.title: 500 Keys
seasons.episode_plot: While Homer takes the Duff Blimp for a joyride, Lisa discovers a secret room in the basement of Sprinfield Elementary School.

seasons.title: The Ned-Liest Catch
seasons.episode_plot: When Krabbapple gets suspended and put into detention after hurting Bart, Bart tries to break her out, but it ends that Flanders is the one that saves her life. But soon, Ned figures out that Edna has also dated other men such as Homer, Skinner Comic Book Guy and Aerosmith drummer Joey Kramer.

seasons.title: The Falcon and the D'Ohman
seasons.episode_plot: Homer tries to befriend the new security guard at the nuclear power plant, who for some unknown reason isn't interested and keeps having flashbacks to his violent past as a government agent.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
seasons.title: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
seasons.episode_plot: Superintendant Chalmers gets fired after using unconventional methods to teach Bart and his friends about Teddy Roosevelt, so the boys take over Springfield Elementary until he gets his old job back.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXII
seasons.episode_plot: Homer takes a dangerous dive into an isolated canyon on Candy Peak, but when a crashing boulder traps his arm, he channels Aron Ralston to save himself. In "The Diving Bell and Butterball," the first of three hair-raising Halloween tales, a venomous spider bite leaves Homer paralyzed, but when Lisa discovers Homer's ability to communicate through natural gases, he is able to express his love for Marge. The killer spells continue in "Dial D for Diddly," when Ned Flanders, devout preacher by day, transforms into a cold-blooded vigilante by night. In the final terrifying...

seasons.title: Replaceable You
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is betrayed by his new assistant at work and winds up working for her, and Bart and Martin create a science project that brings joy to the seniors at the Springfield Retirement Castle.

seasons.title: The Food Wife
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is worried that he is no longer the cool parent after Marge, Bart, and Lisa become foodies.

seasons.title: The Book Job
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Bart put together a team to author the next successful tween novel franchise and make a million dollars, but discover that they need Lisa's help to pull it off.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
seasons.title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
seasons.episode_plot: Homer gets promoted to accounts manager at the nuclear power plant, but soon learns the job robs you of your soul. Meanwhile, Lisa introduces Bart to "Little Women."

seasons.title: The Ten-Per-Cent Solution
seasons.episode_plot: Krusty the Clown is stuck in a rut when the television network pulls his show from the air and his talent agency drops him as a client. But when the Simpsons introduce him to seasoned agent Annie, they are surprised to learn that Annie was Krusty's very first agent. Despite their rocky relationship, Annie is convinced to re-sign Krusty and craft his career comeback. But when Krusty's retro comedy show reboot is deemed a critical success, Krusty must decide to stay with his agent or side with the network executives.

seasons.title: Holidays of Future Passed
seasons.episode_plot: Thirty years in the future the Simpsons get together for Christmas. Bart and Lisa are struggling as parents to connect with their children.

seasons.title: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson
seasons.episode_plot: Homer becomes the host of a popular political talk show, starts an "everyman" movement in Springfield, and ends up hand-picking Ted Nugent as the Republican nominee for president.

seasons.title: The D'oh-cial Network
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa creates an online social network that becomes a Springfield obsession, but later becomes a victim of user backlash.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
seasons.title: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
seasons.episode_plot: While Bart tries to regain Milhouse's friendship, Moe's bar cleaning rag tells his unlikely story of how he got to where he is today.

seasons.title: The Daughter Also Rises
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa falls for an adventurous, Hemingway-esque young boy, while Bart and Millhouse set out to bust all the myths that surround Springfield Elementary School.

seasons.title: At Long Last Leave
seasons.episode_plot: The town votes to kick the Simpsons out of Springfield, so they decide to move to the Outlands.

seasons.title: Exit Through the Kwik-E-Mart
seasons.episode_plot: Bart becomes an urban vandal and decides to use Homer as his inspiration, while Apu hits hard times when a new trendy market takes all the Kwik-E-Mart customers.

seasons.title: How I Wet Your Mother
seasons.episode_plot: The family break into Homer's dreams Inception-style after he begins wetting the bed.

seasons.title: Them, Robot
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns replaces all of the nuclear plant employees with robots--except for Homer, who stays along to supervise the robots and serve as a human scapegoat.

seasons.title: Beware My Cheating Bart
seasons.episode_plot: Jimbo's girlfriend cheats on Jimbo with Bart, and Homer uses his new treadmill to catch up on a TV series about plane crash victims stranded on an island.

seasons.epi_image_alt: A Totally Fun Thing Bart Will Never Do Again
seasons.title: A Totally Fun Thing Bart Will Never Do Again
seasons.episode_plot: Bart gets the family to take the cruise vacation of his dreams, and then launches a fiendish plot to ensure that it goes on forever.

seasons.title: The Spy Who Learned Me
seasons.episode_plot: Homer uses his paid sick leave to improve his marriage, with the help of his imaginary friend, super-spy Stradivarius Cain. Meanwhile, Bart gets revenge on Nelson for stealing everyone's lunch money.

seasons.title: Ned 'N Edna's Blend Agenda
seasons.episode_plot: After Ned and Edna announce publicly that they were secretly married, the two clash over how to raise Rod and Todd.

seasons.title: Lisa Goes Gaga
seasons.episode_plot: After a desperate attempt by Lisa to become more popular backfires, Lady Gaga shows up in Springfield to help her with her self-esteem.

seasons.title: Moonshine River
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons go back to New York City so that Bart can find his old girlfriend Mary Spuckler. Meanwhile, Lisa and Marge spend the trip trying to take in New York culture on the cheap.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIII
seasons.episode_plot: A black hole threatens to swallow Springfield, Homer tries to find the source of paranormal activity, and a "Back to the Future" parody in which Bart keeps Marge from marrying Homer.

seasons.title: Adventures in Baby-Getting
seasons.episode_plot: Marge decides that she wants another baby, but Homer doesn't want one. Meanwhile, Bart tries to figure out where Lisa is secretly going after school.

seasons.title: Gone Abie Gone
seasons.episode_plot: Homer invests Lisa's college fund on an online poker site. Meanwhile Abe disappears from the Springfield Retirement Castle.

seasons.title: Penny-Wiseguys
seasons.episode_plot: Fat Tony has to serve jury duty, and his clerk, Dan, must run the mafia while he's gone. Meanwhile, Lisa considers making a disgusting change to her diet.

seasons.title: A Tree Grows in Springfield
seasons.episode_plot: Homer becomes addicted to his new tablet computer. But when it is destroyed Homer becomes despondent, until he finds and provides hope for Springfield in the most unlikely place.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
seasons.title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
seasons.episode_plot: Homer befriends a hipster and invites his family to move in next door. However, their friendship soon sours as Springfield is transformed into a haven for "coolness."

seasons.title: To Cur with Love
seasons.episode_plot: When Homer shows no remorse over almost losing Santa's Little Helper, Grandpa tells everyone the story of Homer's childhood dog.

seasons.title: Homer Goes to Prep School
seasons.episode_plot: Homer joins the "Springfield Preppers," an off-the-grid survivalist group whose leader has set up a top-secret retreat outside of town to prepare for the end of the world.

seasons.title: A Test Before Trying
seasons.episode_plot: The fate of Springfield Elementary rests on Bart and his test scores, and Homer finds way to make money with his own parking meter.

seasons.title: Changing of the Guardian
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Marge find the perfect young couple and ask them to be the guardians for the kids in case something happens to them.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Love Is a Many Splintered Thing
seasons.title: Love Is a Many Splintered Thing
seasons.episode_plot: Mary Spuckler returns to Springfield and begins a relationship with Bart. However, Bart treats her with disrespect.

seasons.title: Hardly Kirk-ing
seasons.episode_plot: Bart poses Millhouse as his father so that they can do adult activities, and Homer becomes skilled at finding lost objects thanks to Highlights magazine.

seasons.title: Gorgeous Grampa
seasons.episode_plot: Homer's obsession with the TV show "Storage Battles" leads the family to discover Grampa's past identity as "Gorgeous Godfrey," the most feared, villainous man in pro-wrestling history

seasons.title: Black-Eyed, Please
seasons.episode_plot: Ned gets fed up with Homer and punches him in the eye, and Lisa is a bullying victim from her new substitute teacher.

seasons.title: Dark Knight Court
seasons.episode_plot: When Bart is accused of a prank he says he didn't commit, Lisa is forced to defend him in youth court, with former attorney general Janet Reno serving as judge.

seasons.title: What Animated Women Want
seasons.episode_plot: Homer contemplates his next move after getting in the doghouse with Marge, while Millhouse's new Stanley Kowalski-inspired persona makes him suddenly attractive to Lisa.

seasons.title: Pulpit Friction
seasons.episode_plot: Springfield gets a bedbug scare, the new assistant pastor at church appoints Homer as a deacon, and Marge loses her wedding dress.

seasons.title: Whiskey Business
seasons.episode_plot: A new makeover could put Moe in a position to make big money, Bart fails at his job of taking care of Grandpa, and Lisa fights the shameless exploitation of Bleeding Gums Murphy's likeness.

seasons.title: The Fabulous Faker Boy
seasons.episode_plot: Bart takes piano lessons from a cute Russian girl, Marge tries to teach the girl's father how to drive, and Homer loses the last of his hair.

seasons.title: The Saga of Carl
seasons.episode_plot: Homer, Moe, Lenny and Carl win the lottery, but Carl steals the ticket and leaves with the money for Iceland.

seasons.title: Dangers on a Train
seasons.episode_plot: When Marge tries to buy Homer snack cakes for their anniversary, she winds up meeting a married man who shares a common love of British television.

seasons.title: Homerland
seasons.episode_plot: Homer returns from a nuclear power convention a changed man, and Lisa begins to suspect that he has become a domestic terrorist.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIV
seasons.episode_plot: The scariest Simpsons Halloween show yet, featuring an opening by Guillermo Del Toro.

seasons.title: Four Regrettings and a Funeral
seasons.episode_plot: While attending a funeral, Homer, Marge, Mr. Burns, and Kent Brockman recall a past regret and try to find a way to rectify the situation.

seasons.title: YOLO
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is stunned to learn he'll only live once. A pen pal from his youth helps him live that life to its fullest. Meanwhile Springfield Elementary institutes an honor code.

seasons.title: Labor Pains
seasons.episode_plot: Homer helps take care of a child that he delivered in an elevator, and Lisa tries to organize the Springfield Atoms cheerleaders against the team's greedy owner.

seasons.title: The Kid Is All Right
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa is distressed when she discovers that her new friend is a Republican, and they wind up running against each other as Springfield Elementary's second grade representative.

seasons.title: Yellow Subterfuge
seasons.episode_plot: Principal Skinner promises the students that the best-behaved can take a ride in a submarine. Bart believes his past indiscretions will be forgotten. Lisa tries to help Krusty by suggesting him to sell the foreign rights to his shows.

seasons.title: White Christmas Blues
seasons.episode_plot: When a sudden tourist spike means that the family cannot afford Christmas, the Simpsons open up their house to boarders.

seasons.title: Steal This Episode
seasons.episode_plot: Fed up with the high price of Hollywood films, Homer begins screening pirated movies in his backyard, but is busted by the FBI after Marge turns him in.

seasons.title: Married to the Blob
seasons.episode_plot: Comic Book Guy seeks romantic advice from Homer when he falls for a Japanese woman who's interested in manga.

seasons.title: Specs and the City
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns' Christmas present to his employees, a pair of augmented reality glasses, places a strain on Homer and Marge's relationship. Meanwhile, Bart wrestles with giving a Valentine's Day card to Nelson.

seasons.title: Diggs
seasons.episode_plot: Bart becomes friends with a schoolmate who enjoys falconry, but turns out to be mentally disturbed.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Man Who Grew Too Much
seasons.title: The Man Who Grew Too Much
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa becomes friends with Sideshow Bob, who now has a new job working with genetically-altered foods. Meanwhile, Marge becomes frustrated teaching abstinence for the church.

seasons.title: The Winter of His Content
seasons.episode_plot: When Abe and two of his friends move in with the Simpsons after the Springfield Retirement Castle closes, Homer begins to embrace their lifestyle. Meanwhile, Nelson initiates Bart into the bully group after coming to his defense.

seasons.title: The War of Art
seasons.episode_plot: The friendship between the Simpsons and the Van Houtens is challenged when a painting the Simpsons buy from the Van Houtens' yard sale is discovered to be extremely valuable.

seasons.epi_image_alt: You Don't Have to Live Like a Referee
seasons.title: You Don't Have to Live Like a Referee
seasons.episode_plot: Homer becomes a referee for the World Cup and finds himself tested by bribers when the Simpsons travel to Brazil.

seasons.title: Luca$
seasons.episode_plot: Marge becomes worried when Lisa starts dating a competitive eater-in-training, while Bart receives gifts from Snake Jailbird for helping him out.

seasons.title: Days of Future Future
seasons.episode_plot: Thirty years into the future, Bart is having trouble dealing with his divorce, Lisa is struggling with her marriage to Milhouse, and Marge is finally fed up after burying yet another Homer clone.

seasons.epi_image_alt: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting
seasons.title: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting
seasons.episode_plot: Bart becomes a savior to Springfield couples trying to conceive when he inadvertently uses voodoo to get his art teacher pregnant.

seasons.title: Brick Like Me
seasons.episode_plot: The Lego version of Homer begins to suspect that his entire Lego world is not real when a toy triggers a flashback to an alternate reality.

seasons.title: Pay Pal
seasons.episode_plot: When Homer ruins his and Marge's chances of making a new couple friend, Marge decides to concentrate on finding a friend for Lisa. However, Lisa suddenly makes a new friend on her own.

seasons.title: The Yellow Badge of Cowardge
seasons.episode_plot: Bart wins the annual "last day of school" race - with a little help from Nelson - and Homer attempts to bring back 4th of July fireworks, which have been canceled due to low budget cuts.

seasons.title: Clown in the Dumps
seasons.episode_plot: Krusty has a crisis of conscience and retires from show business after his father dies before ever approving of his career. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes worried about Homer's health and life expectancy.

seasons.title: The Wreck of the Relationship
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Bart turn to the open seas to improve their relationship, and Marge becomes a trash talking victim after she drafts Homer's fantasy football team.

seasons.title: Super Franchise Me
seasons.episode_plot: Marge opens a sandwich franchise store after her sandwiches become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. But running day-to-day at the store proves challenging, especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXV
seasons.episode_plot: The 25th annual 'Simpsons' Halloween special includes an alternate dimension, a "Clockwork Orange"-style gang led by Moe and a visit from the Tracey Ullman-era Simpsons.

seasons.title: Opposites A-Frack
seasons.episode_plot: An Assemblywoman brought in by Lisa to stop Mr. Burns' fracking operation ends up falling for him as much as he does for her.

seasons.title: Simpsorama
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons meet the Planet Express crew, who have come to Springfield in the present to stop them from destroying the future.

seasons.title: Blazed and Confused
seasons.episode_plot: Bart tricks his family into a camping trip at a strange event known as "Blazing Guy" so that he can get revenge on his sadistic new fourth grade teacher.

seasons.title: Covercraft
seasons.episode_plot: Homer forms a cover band with other dads in town when he takes up bass guitar to deal with a mid-life crisis, but the band's modest success is soon overwhelmed by Apu's breakout potential.

seasons.epi_image_alt: I Won't Be Home for Christmas
seasons.title: I Won't Be Home for Christmas
seasons.episode_plot: Marge kicks Homer out of the house for Christmas after he consoles Moe on Christmas Eve instead of going home.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
seasons.title: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
seasons.episode_plot: An amusement park ride takes the Simpsons to the home planet of Kang and Kodos.

seasons.title: Bart's New Friend
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is hypnotized into believing he's ten years old and ends up stuck in his new age when the hypnotist dies, so he bonds with Bart and refuses to take back the responsibilities of adulthood.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Musk Who Fell to Earth
seasons.title: The Musk Who Fell to Earth
seasons.episode_plot: Inventor Elon Musk comes to Springfield, and Homer inspires him with a new idea that could revolutionize Springfield, but winds up costing Mr. Burns a ton of money.

seasons.title: Walking Big & Tall
seasons.episode_plot: Marge tries to get Homer to lose weight. But instead, he finds a support group that encourages him to embrace his largeness.

seasons.title: My Fare Lady
seasons.episode_plot: Marge gets a job as a driver for a transportation app service, while Moe is forced to work as a janitor at the nuclear plant after Homer causes the bar to go bankrupt.

seasons.title: The Princess Guide
seasons.episode_plot: Moe falls in love with a Nigerian princess whose father is working out a uranium deal with Mr. Burns.

seasons.title: Sky Police
seasons.episode_plot: The congregation, led by Marge, is forced to resort to gambling in order to collect money to fix the church, which Chief Wiggum destroyed with a jet pack he received by mistake.

seasons.title: Waiting for Duffman
seasons.episode_plot: After "Duffman" retires, Homer wins a reality competition to become his replacement. But his contract states that he cannot drink beer, which gives him a new perspective on alcohol.

seasons.title: Peeping Mom
seasons.episode_plot: Marge decides to follow Bart everywhere until he confesses to being involved in a bulldozer crash. Meanwhile, Homer ignores Santa's Little Helper when Ned gets a new dog.

seasons.title: The Kids Are All Fight
seasons.episode_plot: The story of Bart and Lisa's rivalry is told when Homer finds an old film strip.

seasons.title: Let's Go Fly a Coot
seasons.episode_plot: Bart takes up smoking e-cigarettes to impress Milhouse's cousin Annika while the rest of the family learns about Grampa's days in the Air Force.

seasons.title: Bull-E
seasons.episode_plot: Bart gets bullied at a school dance, so Marge gets an anti-bullying law passed, which results in Homer being put in therapy for bulling Ned.

seasons.title: Mathlete's Feat
seasons.episode_plot: Groundskeeper Willie becomes the coach of the mathletes, Lisa and other kids from Springfield Elementary compete against Waverly Hills Elementary.

seasons.title: Every Man's Dream
seasons.episode_plot: Marge decides it's finally time to separate from Homer, and quickly moves on with her life. Homer is initially devastated, but soon stumbles into a romance with a younger woman.

seasons.title: 'Cue Detective
seasons.episode_plot: A celebrity television chef challenges Homer to a barbecue cook-off. But before the competition, Homer's new, prized barbecue grill is stolen.

seasons.title: Puffless
seasons.episode_plot: Patty and Selma try to quit smoking, but Patty moves in with the Simpsons when Selma takes it up again. Meanwhile, Maggie goes on an adventure with some local creatures.

seasons.title: Halloween of Horror
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons are proud to be the most festively decorated house on the block. But when Lisa is traumatized at Krustyland Horror Night, she feels she cannot handle Halloween anymore.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVI
seasons.episode_plot: After killing Bart, Sideshow Bob doesn't know what to do with himself; Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss; Because of radiation, Lisa, Bart and Milhouse gain super-powers.

seasons.title: Friend with Benefit
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa makes a new friend at school - Harper, who happens to be super-rich, while Homer makes friends with Harper's dad and sets out to continue living the good life when Lisa decides to end the friendship.

seasons.title: Lisa with an "S"
seasons.episode_plot: Broadway legend Laney Fontaine transforms Lisa into a show-biz kid after Homer loses her chance at band camp.

seasons.title: Paths of Glory
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa tries to restore the reputation of a forgotten Springfield female inventor, while Bart takes full advantage of a diagnosis that he is a sociopath.

seasons.title: Barthood
seasons.episode_plot: A tale of Bart's journey from youth to adulthood, where he is constantly in search of approval from his father and in the shadow of his more-successful younger sister.

seasons.title: The Girl Code
seasons.episode_plot: When Homer loses his job due to Marge's social media post, he begins working as a dishwasher at a Greek restaurant. Meanwhile, Lisa creates an app that can predict the effect any post on social media will have.

seasons.title: Teenage Mutant Milk-Caused Hurdles
seasons.episode_plot: Bart and Principal Skinner battle over the affection of Bart's new teacher, and a new milk-based product that Homer buys from the Kwik-E-Mart causes big changes in Bart and Lisa.

seasons.title: Much Apu About Something
seasons.episode_plot: Apu's nephew makes big changes when he takes over the Kwik-E-Mart business, and Bart decides that he's through with being bad after his latest prank spirals out of control.

seasons.title: Love Is in the N2-O2-Ar-CO2-Ne-He-CH4
seasons.episode_plot: Professor Frink's new invention turns him into a ladies' man, while a new pill at the Springfield Retirement Castle causes Grandpa to hallucinate back to his happiest moments.

seasons.title: Gal of Constant Sorrow
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa tries to launch the career of a homeless Appalachian folk singer, but Bart warns her that she will just let her down. Meanwhile, Homer tries to rescue the cat, who is trapped in the walls of the house.

seasons.title: Lisa the Veterinarian
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa takes a job as veterinarian's assistant, but soon lets the responsibilities of the job get to her head. Meanwhile, Marge decides to take a job as a crime scene cleaner.

seasons.title: The Marge-ian Chronicles
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa signs up for an opportunity to be part of a mission to colonize Mars in ten years, and Homer's strategy to use reverse psychology to talk her out of it backfires.

seasons.title: The Burns Cage
seasons.episode_plot: Homer tries to raise Smithers' spirits by finding him a man, and Lisa gets the lead in the school production of "Casablanca" alongside a new male student, sparking Millhouse's jealousy.

seasons.epi_image_alt: How Lisa Got Her Marge Back
seasons.title: How Lisa Got Her Marge Back
seasons.episode_plot: After Lisa overhears Marge say that she doesn't like Lisa's jazz music, Marge takes Lisa on a trip to Capitol City to regain her friendship. Meanwhile, Bart uses Maggie as his new partner in crime for his practical jokes.

seasons.title: Fland Canyon
seasons.episode_plot: Maggie will not go to sleep, so Homer tells her a bedtime story about when the Simpsons and the Flanders went to the Grand Canyon together.

seasons.title: To Courier with Love
seasons.episode_plot: After promising Marge the trip of a lifetime, Homer makes a deal with a travel agent to be a courier of a top-secret briefcase in exchange for a discounted family vacation to Paris.

seasons.title: Simprovised
seasons.episode_plot: While trying to overcome a fear of public speaking, Homer creates an improv comedy troupe; Marge rebuilds Bart's treehouse.

seasons.title: Orange Is the New Yellow
seasons.episode_plot: Marge lets Bart go to the park alone because he's too irritating, then she ends up getting arrested for leaving him unsupervised.

seasons.title: Monty Burns' Fleeing Circus
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns puts on a variety show at the Springfield Bowl.

seasons.title: Friends and Family
seasons.episode_plot: Homer finds a new friend in a woman who acts just like him when Mr. Burns hires the other Simpsons as his live-in virtual reality family.

seasons.title: The Town
seasons.episode_plot: Homer takes the family on a "hate-cation" to Boston after he catches Bart rooting for a rival football team.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVII
seasons.episode_plot: The children of Springfield fight to the death, Hunger Games style; Lisa's imaginary friend kills her real friends; Moe recruits Bart into his group of covert barfly agents.

seasons.title: Trust But Clarify
seasons.episode_plot: Bart and Lisa investigate Krusty's new candy; Marge helps Homer dress for a promotion; Kent Brockman struggles with the changing media world.

seasons.title: There Will Be Buds
seasons.episode_plot: Homer coaches the kids' lacrosse team with Kirk Van Houten, who disappears before the championship game, after Homer rants about him being a loser.

seasons.title: Havana Wild Weekend
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons go to Cuba to get Grampa cheap medical care when the Retirement Castle and V.A. hospital are unable to solve his health problems.

seasons.title: Dad Behavior
seasons.episode_plot: Homer discovers an app that makes his life easier, while Grampa learns that he'll be a father again.

seasons.title: The Last Traction Hero
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is placed in a cast following a workplace accident, leading Marge to receive romance from an unexpected source; Lisa attempts to keep the peace as bus monitor.

seasons.title: The Nightmare After Krustmas
seasons.episode_plot: Krusty and his daughter spend Christmas with the Simpsons; Reverend Lovejoy seeks converts to boost attendance at church; A Christmas toy scares Maggie.

seasons.title: Pork and Burns
seasons.episode_plot: A Japanese book on minimalism inspires Marge to adapt to a new way of living, so the Simpsons have to part with items that no longer bring them joy.

seasons.title: The Great Phatsby
seasons.episode_plot: Mr Burns tries to relive his glory days, and crosses paths with a mysterious music mogul.

seasons.title: Fatzcarraldo
seasons.episode_plot: When all the fast food restaurants in Springfield become healthy, Homer turns to the last bastion of greasy food for comfort; Lisa must find a good news story when her school radio station is in jeopardy.

seasons.title: The Cad and the Hat
seasons.episode_plot: Bart ruins Lisa's perfect day out of jealousy and becomes haunted by the manifestation of his guilty conscious. Homer is revealed to be a master chess player which helps him bond with his competitive dad.

seasons.title: Kamp Krustier
seasons.episode_plot: Bart and Lisa return home following a traumatic incident at Kamp Krusty, putting an end to Homer and Marge's sexual encounters.

seasons.title: 22 for 30
seasons.episode_plot: A mocumentary about how Bart became a star basketball player at Springfield Elementary only to fall prey to fame, his own ego and the schemes of mobster Fat Tony.

seasons.title: A Father's Watch
seasons.episode_plot: As Homer and Marge try a different parenting style on the hellraising Bart, Grampa gives him a special watch that becomes Bart's moral center. But Bart loses it and tries everything to get it back.

seasons.title: The Caper Chase
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns opens his own for-profit university, hiring the completely unqualified Homer as a professor, only to lose him to a mad scientist.

seasons.title: Looking for Mr. Goodbart
seasons.episode_plot: Bart bonds with Skinner's mother over their mutual dislike of Skinner and realizes that he could make a bundle by befriending other lonely and disgruntled grandmothers of Springfield for money.

seasons.title: Moho House
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns makes a bet with his old friend that nothing can break Homer and Marge apart. But that's where Moe comes in.

seasons.title: Dogtown
seasons.episode_plot: After a successful animal rights campaign, all dogs in Springfield are allowed to go where they want and do what they want. Pack mentality quickly kicks in and the dogs of Springfield assert their dominance by threatening the people.

seasons.title: The Serfsons
seasons.episode_plot: In a medieval world, Lisa is forced to use illegal magic when Marge's mother is turned into an Ice Walker.

seasons.title: Springfield Splendor
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa's sad experience is adapted into a graphic novel, which becomes a Broadway show.

seasons.title: Whistler's Father
seasons.episode_plot: Homer launches Maggie's baby-celebrity career with her whistling talent; Marge is hired to style Fat Tony's brothel.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVIII
seasons.episode_plot: Maggie gets possessed by a demon; Lisa discovers a creepy/perfect version of her family in an alternative universe; Homer cannibalizes himself.

seasons.title: Grampy Can Ya Hear Me
seasons.episode_plot: Grampa gets a hearing aid and finally hears what everyone has been saying about him.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used To Be
seasons.title: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used To Be
seasons.episode_plot: Marge runs for mayor and uses Homer as the butt of her jokes to gain public support.

seasons.title: Singin' in the Lane
seasons.episode_plot: Homer gets his old bowling team back together and they wind up competing with arrogant millionaires.

seasons.title: Mr. Lisa's Opus
seasons.episode_plot: In the future, Lisa writes a college application essay to Harvard and recalls disappointing past birthdays that helped shape her.

seasons.title: Gone Boy
seasons.episode_plot: When Bart goes missing, the town puts together a search party to find him.

seasons.title: Haw-Haw Land
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa falls for a crooning jazz pianist named Brendan; Bart discovers he has an affinity for chemistry.

seasons.title: Frink Gets Testy
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns builds a doomsday ark after he believes the world is ending; Professor Frink is tasked with determining who is worth saving.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Homer is Where the Art Isn't
seasons.title: Homer is Where the Art Isn't
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is accused of stealing a multimillion-dollar painting and only freelance insurance investigator Manacek can prove his innocence or guilt.

seasons.epi_image_alt: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
seasons.title: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they went from loving life without kids to being miserable parents.

seasons.title: Fears of a Clown
seasons.episode_plot: Bart goes to prankster rehab after a clown-mask prank terrifies the town and ruins Krusty's career causing him to give up comedy and try serious drama.

seasons.title: No Good Read Goes Unpunished
seasons.episode_plot: Marge forces everyone to give up their electronics and go to the book store in an effort to bring the family together.

seasons.title: King Leer
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Marge attempt to reunite Moe with his troubled family.

seasons.title: Lisa Gets the Blues
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons' flight to Gainesville gets re-routed to New Orleans, where Lisa must regain her confidence as a jazz musician.

seasons.title: Forgive and Regret
seasons.episode_plot: On his deathbed, Grampa makes a confession to Homer about the notes from Homer's mother that got lost when she left. This angers Homer to the point of refusing to reconcile with Abe after he miraculously recovers.

seasons.title: Left Behind
seasons.episode_plot: Homer gets Flanders a job at the power plant; Marge feels there's no spark left in their marriage.

seasons.title: Throw Grampa from the Dane
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons go to Denmark so Grampa can benefit from its free health-care system.

seasons.title: Flanders' Ladder
seasons.episode_plot: When Bart falls into a coma after he is struck by lightning, he is visited by ghosts seeking closure.

seasons.title: Bart's Not Dead
seasons.episode_plot: Bart ends up in the hospital after taking a dare and lies about going to heaven to cover it up, but Homer takes a deal with Christian producers to make a movie about it.

seasons.title: Heartbreak Hotel
seasons.episode_plot: Marge and Homer travel to a tropical island and go on Marge's favorite reality competition program to win a million dollars.

seasons.epi_image_alt: My Way or the Highway to Heaven
seasons.title: My Way or the Highway to Heaven
seasons.episode_plot: While God and St. Peter discuss who will get into heaven, the citizens of Springfield recall divine encounters.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIX
seasons.episode_plot: Homer wins an oyster-eating contest against the mythical Cthulhu, Springfield is overrun by plant body-snatchers, Lisa finally snaps and Mr. Burns opens a retirement home with some Jurassic upgrades.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Baby You Can't Drive My Car
seasons.title: Baby You Can't Drive My Car
seasons.episode_plot: A self-driving car company comes to Springfield, poaching all of the power plant employees with their fun work environment.

seasons.title: From Russia Without Love
seasons.episode_plot: Bart, Nelson and Milhouse get a mail-order bride for Moe as a hardcore prank.

seasons.title: Werking Mom
seasons.episode_plot: In search of a job, Marge gets one selling plastic food storage containers - as a drag queen; Lisa tries to make the world better.

seasons.title: Krusty the Clown
seasons.episode_plot: Krusty hides out at a circus after he nearly kills Homer, who becomes a TV recapper and gives him a bad grade.

seasons.title: Daddicus Finch
seasons.episode_plot: Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge attempts to help Homer balance attention between the kids.

seasons.title: 'Tis the 30th Season
seasons.episode_plot: Marge is determined to fix Christmas following a failed Black Friday shopping spree, but Homer and the kids surprise her with a vacation in Florida.

seasons.title: Mad About the Toy
seasons.episode_plot: Motivated by a PTSD episode Grampa had while babysitting the kids, the Simpsons take a journey to Grampa's past as a post-WW2 toy model for plastic army men, and Abe finally faces his on confused sexuality.

seasons.title: The Girl on the Bus
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa tries to live a double life when she makes a new friend and gets a taste of what it would be like to live with a more cultured family.

seasons.epi_image_alt: I'm Dancing as Fat as I Can
seasons.title: I'm Dancing as Fat as I Can
seasons.episode_plot: Homer tries to make amends for binging his and Marge's favorite show without her; Bart prepares for "Krusty's Holiday Trample".

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Clown Stays in the Picture
seasons.title: The Clown Stays in the Picture
seasons.episode_plot: On Marc Maron's podcast, Krusty reveals the untold story of his past movie project, The Sands of Space. Hearing the podcast, Bart and Lisa learn their parents were production assistants on the movie in the early days of their relationship.

seasons.title: 101 Mitigations
seasons.episode_plot: Homer steals Comic Book Guy's car and must either prove his innocence in court or reconcile with him.

seasons.title: I Want You (She's So Heavy)
seasons.episode_plot: When a romantic night ends in injury for Homer and Marge, Lisa turns to an unlikely source to fix their strained relationship.

seasons.title: E My Sports
seasons.episode_plot: Homer discovers a passion for coaching Bart in video game competitions; Lisa's plan to bring Homer back to reality creates chaos.

seasons.title: Bart vs. Itchy & Scratchy
seasons.episode_plot: Bart's friends start a boys rights activist group to protest Krusty's all-female reboot of Itchy and Scratchy. When they catch Bart enjoying it, they kick him out, so he joins Bossy Riot, a militant feminist gang of sixth-grade girls.

seasons.title: Girl's in the Band
seasons.episode_plot: Homer works extra shifts at the plant so Lisa can play in the Capitol City Youth Philharmonic.

seasons.epi_image_alt: I'm Just a Girl Who Can't Say D'oh
seasons.title: I'm Just a Girl Who Can't Say D'oh
seasons.episode_plot: Marge becomes Director of Springfield's local theater, armed with Lisa's script resembling "Hamilton"; Homer joins a baby class with Maggie, and takes a liking to supervisor Chloe.

seasons.title: D'oh Canada
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa is mistakenly given political asylum in Canada during a family trip to Niagara Falls.

seasons.title: Woo-Hoo Dunnit?
seasons.episode_plot: The documentary crime series "Dateline: Springfield" goes in-depth to solve the case of Lisa's missing college fund.

seasons.title: Crystal Blue-Haired Persuasion
seasons.episode_plot: Marge starts a business selling healing crystals and other New Age products to the naive mothers of Springfield when Homer's job cuts children's health-care benefits, leading Marge to use the crystals as a cheaper solution for Bart's ADD.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Winter of Our Monetized Content
seasons.title: The Winter of Our Monetized Content
seasons.episode_plot: Bart and Homer become social media celebrities when a video of them fighting goes viral; Lisa fights the school's new industrialized detention system.

seasons.title: Go Big or Go Homer
seasons.episode_plot: Homer inspires a 35-year-old millennial who idolizes him to start his own business, which leads the mob to chase both of them.

seasons.title: The Fat Blue Line
seasons.episode_plot: When the wrong man is arrested for pickpocketing Springfield during the San Castellaneta street festival, Chief Wiggum sets out to catch the real criminal.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXX
seasons.episode_plot: The 30th Treehouse of Horror features a demon Maggie, a mission to rescue Milhouse from another dimension, dead-Homer's spirit trying on some new bodies for size and Selma finally finding love in an unlikely place - the alien in the basement.

seasons.title: Gorillas on the Mast
seasons.episode_plot: After visiting Aquatraz Water Park, Lisa and Bart set out to free from captivity the most vicious animals in Springfield. Homer fulfills a lifelong dream and buys a boat, only to realize how much boat ownership sucks.

seasons.title: Marge the Lumberjill
seasons.episode_plot: Marge becomes a competitive lumberjack and goes on a month-long retreat to Portland with her trainer, whom Homer fears will take his wife away from him.

seasons.title: Livin la Pura Vida
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons join other Springfield families on the Van Houtens' annual trip to Costa Rica, where Homer befriends Patty's new girlfriend and Lisa discovers how the Van Houtens are able to afford this trip every year.

seasons.title: Thanksgiving of Horror
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons face various Thanksgiving nightmares, including the first Thanksgiving, an A.I. mishap and a dangerous space mission complicated by a sentient cranberry sauce.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Todd, Todd, Why Hast Thou Forsaken Me?
seasons.title: Todd, Todd, Why Hast Thou Forsaken Me?
seasons.episode_plot: Todd blames God for his mother's death and rejects his faith, so Ned sends him to live with the Simpsons, hoping they can scare him into believing in God again.

seasons.title: Bobby, It's Cold Outside
seasons.episode_plot: Sideshow Bob gets the role of Santa Claus at Santa's Village amusement park. Meanwhile, someone is stealing all the Christmas packages off people's front porches.

seasons.title: Hail to the Teeth
seasons.episode_plot: Homer and Marge attend Artie Ziff's wedding and become quite uncomfortable when they realize that his bride-to-be is a clone of Marge.

seasons.title: The Miseducation of Lisa Simpson
seasons.episode_plot: The sea captain finds treasure for which he's been searching for 40 years, but City Hall claims it since it was in city limits. Marge convinces the townspeople to use the windfall to build a STEM school. Homer crusades against automation.

seasons.title: Frinkcoin
seasons.episode_plot: Professor Frink invents a cryptocurrency that makes him the richest man in Springfield, a title Mr. Burns has no intention of giving up.

seasons.title: Bart the Bad Guy
seasons.episode_plot: Bart uses spoilers for a superhero movie he saw to get what he wants, but two movie executives will stop at nothing to keep his knowledge secret.

seasons.title: Screenless
seasons.episode_plot: Marge implements a limit on screen time for the whole family, only to realize she's the one addicted to screens.

seasons.title: Better Off Ned
seasons.episode_plot: Jealous of Bart's bond with Ned, Homer mentors Nelson in retaliation, but an act of heroism helps Homer to regain Bart's respect.

seasons.title: Highway to Well
seasons.episode_plot: Marge gets a job at an upscale cannabis dispensary leading Homer to open a competing business that replicates the scuzzy days of scoring weed from and old-school pot connection.

seasons.epi_image_alt: The Incredible Lightness of Being a Baby
seasons.title: The Incredible Lightness of Being a Baby
seasons.episode_plot: Maggie reunites with baby Hudson, but Marge isn't too crazy about his mom. Homer befriends Cletus Spuckler who recently discovered a vast underground reserve of helium gas on his property, attracting unwanted attention from Mr. Burns.

seasons.title: Warrin' Priests
seasons.episode_plot: Reverend Lovejoy investigates the mysterious past of a new priest who's come to town and shaken things up at church.

seasons.title: Warrin' Priests Part 2
seasons.episode_plot: In Michigan, Reverend Lovejoy learns the true reason why Bode came to Springfield and the congregation must decide whether to banish their new priest.

seasons.title: The Hateful Eight-Year-Olds
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa joins a group of rich girls when she makes a friend who loves horses; Homer takes Marge on a romantic cruise.

seasons.title: The Way of the Dog
seasons.episode_plot: The Simpsons explore the tragic past of Santa's Little Helper when he bites Marge.

seasons.title: Undercover Burns
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns goes undercover at the power plant as an employee named Fred and befriends Homer and the gang, but a jealous Smithers plots to bring the old Burns back.

seasons.title: I, Carumbus
seasons.episode_plot: At a museum exhibit of Ancient Rome, Marge and Homer imagine themselves in Rome where Homer is more ambitious.

seasons.title: Now Museum, Now You Don't
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa stays home from school and fantasizes about the history of Western art.

seasons.title: Treehouse of Horror XXXI
seasons.episode_plot: The 31st annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a frightening look at the 2020 election, parodies of Pixar and Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse and a ninth birthday Lisa just can't get over.

seasons.title: The 7 Beer Itch
seasons.episode_plot: Homer is tempted by a British femme fatale while Marge and the kids are on a seaside vacation.

seasons.title: Podcast News
seasons.episode_plot: Grampa is accused of a crime, while Kent Brockman questions his career.

seasons.title: Three Dreams Denied
seasons.episode_plot: Bart becomes a voice over actor, Comic Book Guy is humiliated at Comic-Con and Lisa is set up for a fall.

seasons.title: The Road to Cincinnati
seasons.episode_plot: Skinner and Chalmers take an 800-mile car ride to an administrator's convention in Cincinnati.

seasons.title: Sorry Not Sorry
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa calls Ms. Hoover a hack and refuses to apologize, then learns her private pain.

seasons.epi_image_alt: A Springfield Summer Christmas for Christmas
seasons.title: A Springfield Summer Christmas for Christmas
seasons.episode_plot: A cable channel films a Christmas movie in Springfield and Skinner falls in love.

seasons.title: The Dad-Feelings Limited
seasons.episode_plot: The origin story of Comic Book Guy is revealed as he and Kumiko debate having a baby.

seasons.title: Diary Queen
seasons.episode_plot: Bart learns a surprising secret when he finds Mrs. Krabappel's diary at a yard sale, while Lisa discovers an even bigger surprise.

seasons.title: Wad Goals
seasons.episode_plot: Bart becomes a successful caddy, but Marge thinks it may ruin his character.

seasons.title: Yokel Hero
seasons.episode_plot: Cletus becomes a singing sensation and ruins everything when he turns on his fans, while Homer becomes a new man.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Do Pizza Bots Dream of Electric Guitars
seasons.title: Do Pizza Bots Dream of Electric Guitars
seasons.episode_plot: Homer tries to reunite a mechanical band from his youth, but J.J. Abrams beats him to it.

seasons.title: Manger Things
seasons.episode_plot: A secret from Flanders' past and a never-before-seen room in the Simpson home are revealed.

seasons.title: Uncut Femmes
seasons.episode_plot: Sarah Wiggum is more than she seems; Marge participates in a jewel heist.

seasons.title: Burger Kings
seasons.episode_plot: Mr. Burns joins the plant-based burger business, convincing Lisa that he's changed for the better.

seasons.epi_image_alt: Panic on the Streets of Springfield
seasons.title: Panic on the Streets of Springfield
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa's imaginary friend is a depressed British singer from the 1980s; Homer becomes a truck guy.

seasons.title: Mother and Child Reunion
seasons.episode_plot: Lisa makes a shocking college decision that hurts Marge, leading to a surprising place.

seasons.title: The Man from G.R.A.M.P.A.
seasons.episode_plot: A British secret agent comes to Springfield to find a Russian spy.

seasons.title: The Last Barfighter
seasons.episode_plot: A secret society of bartenders seeks revenge on Homer and his friends when Moe breaks their most sacred rule.
